opennlp.ccg.realize
Class EdgeFactory

java.lang.Object
  opennlp.ccg.realize.EdgeFactory

public class EdgeFactory
extends Object

The EdgeFactory is responsible for creating edges. A single edge factory instance per realization request is assumed.

Version:
$Revision: 1.87 $, $Date: 2011/10/30 21:06:47 $
Author:
Michael White

          Returns all edges that can be created by combining the given edges; if the collectCombos flag is true, the edges are updated with collected combos, and additional alt edges are made for the remaining alternative edges for the given first edge.

labeledNominals

public final Set<Nominal> labeledNominals
Set of nominals whose phrases are marked for labeling in the output (with mark=+).

useIndexing

public boolean useIndexing
Flag for whether to use indexing. Setting retrieved from preferences; turned off when gluing fragments.

debugInstantiation

public boolean debugInstantiation
Flag for whether to debug category instantiation (defaults to false). If true, cases of complex categories whose outermost category is not instantiated with index nominals are reported to System.err. Note that realization is more efficient if such categories can be avoided in the grammar. Uncovered EPs after lex lookup are also reported to System.err.

gluingFragments

public boolean gluingFragments
Flag for whether to glue fragments currently. Defaults to false.

uncoveredEPs

protected BitSet uncoveredEPs
Bit vector for EPs not covered by a lexical edge or rule instance; null if none.

hasUncoveredPreds

public boolean hasUncoveredPreds
Flag indicating whether any lexical or featural EPs are uncovered.

useRelaxedRelationMatching

protected boolean useRelaxedRelationMatching
Flag for whether to use relaxed relation matching.

Method Detail

addLFOptsForUncoveredPreds

public void addLFOptsForUncoveredPreds()
Adds LF optional parts for any preds not covered by a lex item or rule instance, divided up by chunks, for use with fragment gluing or relaxed relation matching.

addLFOptsForRuleInstances

public void addLFOptsForRuleInstances()
Adds an LF optional part for each instantiated rule instance, for use with fragment gluing.

makeEdge

protected Edge makeEdge(Sign sign,
                        BitSet bitset,
                        List<List<Alt>> activeLfAlts)
Makes an edge, computing the completeness percentage, sign score, and indices, and setting the most specific incomplete LF chunk (if any).

makeAltEdge

protected Edge makeAltEdge(Sign altSign,
                           Edge edge)
Makes an edge for the given alt sign from the given edge, after computing the sign's score.

makeJoinedEdge

public Edge makeJoinedEdge(Edge edge1,
                           Edge edge2)
Makes an edge consisting of two joined fragments.

pairedWith

public boolean pairedWith(Edge edgeA,
                          Edge edgeB)
Returns whether the indices for the two edges are paired in the input LF.

createInitialEdges

public List<Edge> createInitialEdges()
Creates and returns all initial edges. In particular, initializes all lexical edges that cover some of the input semantics; also initializes edges for semantically null lexical items, and initializes instances of type changing rules which introduce their own semantics. If a hypertagger is in place, only the beta-best edges are returned for each EP.

createNewEdges

public List<Edge> createNewEdges(Edge edge,
                                 Edge next)
Returns all edges that can be created by combining the given edges, without collecting combos.

createNewEdges

public List<Edge> createNewEdges(Edge edge,
                                 Edge next,
                                 boolean collectCombos)
Returns all edges that can be created by combining the given edges; if the collectCombos flag is true, the edges are updated with collected combos, and additional alt edges are made for the remaining alternative edges for the given first edge.

createNewEdges

public List<Edge> createNewEdges(Edge edge)
Returns all edges that can be created by applying a unary rule to the given edge or by combining it with a purely syntactic edge, without collecting combos.

createNewEdges

public List<Edge> createNewEdges(Edge edge,
                                 boolean collectCombos)
Returns all edges that can be created by applying a unary rule to the given edge, or by combining it with a purely syntactic edge, or by completing a realization/chunk/alt with an optional part, while updating the given edge with collected combos, if the collectCombos flag is true. When gluing fragments, only the opt completion step is done.

createAltEdges

public List<Edge> createAltEdges(Edge edge,
                                 Edge repEdge)
Returns the edges that can be made by constructing alternative edges from the given edge and the collected combos in its representative edge.

ruleApps

public int ruleApps()
Returns the number of rule applications executed.
